comments.body:
The formatting is a bit off for Haskell. The normal formatting would be (with strictness added for `classifier` to match the other fields):

```Haskell
data MavenCoords = MavenCoords
    { groupId :: !GroupId
    , artifactId :: !ArtifactId
    , version :: !TextVersion
    , classifier :: !(Maybe ArtifactType)
    , artifactType :: !ArtifactType
    } deriving Show
```

diffHunk:
@@ -62,10 +68,24 @@ type TextVersion = Text
 type GroupId = [Text]
 type ArtifactId = Text
 type Classifier = Text
+type ArtifactType = Text
+
+-- Fully qualified coordinates for a Maven artifact.
+data MavenCoords = MavenCoords {

comments.body:
Same here --

```Haskell
data MavenUploadConfig = MavenUploadConfig
    { url :: !Text
    , user :: !Text
    , password :: !Text
    ... etc ...
    } deriving (Eq, Show)
```

Also, it's probably not the best to use such generic field names like `url` and `user` and `password` because field names in Haskell share the same namespace with functions. (You couldn't have two records with a `url` field in the same module, for example.) To mitigate this, consider giving the field names a common prefix, like `mucUrl`, `mucUser`, `mucPassword` etc (`muc` short for `MavenUploadConfig`)

diffHunk:
@@ -147,3 +167,24 @@ parseVersion (T.strip -> txt) = do
 
 renderVersion :: Version -> Text
 renderVersion (Version maj min_ patch) = T.intercalate "." [tshow maj, tshow min_, tshow patch]
+
+newtype MavenAllowUnsecureTls = MavenAllowUnsecureTls { getAllowUnsecureTls :: Bool }
+    deriving (Eq, Show, FromJSON)
